SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.crypt

Class PemData

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.crypt.PemData
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<PemData.PemItem>
public class PemData extends Object implements Iterable<PemData.PemItem>
The PemData class is used to parse, manage, and retrieve PEM-formatted data. It provides functionality to handle various PEM types such as certificates, private keys, public keys, and PKCS7 objects. The class also supports extracting and handling specific types of data like certificate chains, public keys, or private keys from the parsed PEM data.

This class implements the Iterable interface to support iteration over its parsed components, which are instances of the nested PemData.PemItem class.

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    PemData.PemException
    Exception class representing errors related to PEM (Privacy-Enhanced Mail) data processing.
    static final record 
    PemData.PemItem
    Represents a single PEM (Privacy-Enhanced Mail) item, consisting of a specific type and its corresponding content.
    static enum 
    PemData.PemType
    Enumeration of PEM (Privacy-Enhanced Mail) types commonly encountered in cryptographic operations.

  • Method Details

    • iterator

      public Iterator<PemData.PemItem> iterator()
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<PemData.PemItem>

    • parse

      public static PemData parse(String pem) throws PemData.PemException
      Parses a PEM formatted string and converts it into a PemData object.
      Parameters:
      pem - the PEM string to be parsed. It is expected to contain PEM-encoded data.
      Returns:
      a PemData object containing the parsed contents of the provided PEM string.
      Throws:
      PemData.PemException - if an error occurs while parsing the PEM string.

    • load

      public static PemData load(Path path) throws IOException, PemData.PemException
      Loads PEM data from the specified file path into a PemData object.
      Parameters:
      path - the Path to the PEM file to be loaded
      Returns:
      a PemData object containing the parsed PEM data
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
      PemData.PemException - if the data in the file is invalid or cannot be parsed

    • load

      public static PemData load(InputStream in) throws IOException, PemData.PemException
      Loads PEM (Privacy-Enhanced Mail) data from an InputStream. This method converts the input stream to a reader with UTF-8 encoding and delegates the actual loading process to another method.
      Parameters:
      in - the input stream from which PEM data will be read
      Returns:
      a PemData object containing the parsed PEM data
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the input stream
      PemData.PemException - if there is an error in processing the PEM data

    • load

      public static PemData load(Reader reader) throws IOException, PemData.PemException
      Loads PEM (Privacy-Enhanced Mail) data from a Reader and returns a PemData object. This method processes the input data, extracts various PEM components, and organizes them into a structured PemData object.
      Parameters:
      reader - the Reader instance from which PEM data will be read
      Returns:
      a PemData object containing the parsed PEM structures
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during reading
      PemData.PemException - if there is an error processing the PEM data

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of items stored in the current PemData instance.
      Returns:
      the total count of items within the collection.

    • get

      public PemData.PemItem get(int index)
      Retrieves the PemItem at the specified index from the list of PEM items.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the item to retrieve, where the index must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than the total number of items in the list.
      Returns:
      the PemItem located at the specified index.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range.

    • getItems

      public List<PemData.PemItem> getItems(PemData.PemType type)
      Retrieves a list of PemItem objects filtered by the specified PemType.
      Parameters:
      type - the PemType to filter items by; only items matching this type will be included in the returned list
      Returns:
      a List of PemItem objects that match the specified PemType

    • toList

      public List<PemData.PemItem> toList()
      Converts the internal collection of PEM items into an unmodifiable list. This method provides a consistent view of the PEM items managed by the containing object, ensuring that the returned list cannot be modified.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of PemItem objects representing the PEM data

    • asCertificate

      public X509Certificate asCertificate() throws PemData.PemException
      Converts the first item in the PEM data collection to an X509Certificate. This method ensures that the collection contains exactly one item of the type PemType.CERTIFICATE, and casts its content to an X509Certificate.
      Returns:
      an X509Certificate object representing the certificate contained in the PEM data.
      Throws:
      PemData.PemException - if the collection does not contain exactly one item or if the item type is not PemType.CERTIFICATE.

    • asCertificateChain

      public List<X509Certificate> asCertificateChain() throws PemData.PemException
      Converts the current PemData instance into a list of X509Certificate objects. Depending on the type of the PEM data, it can either represent a single certificate or a chain of certificates.
      Returns:
      a List of X509Certificate objects representing the certificate(s) contained in the PEM data. Returns an empty List if there are no items.
      Throws:
      PemData.PemException - if the PEM data contains multiple unrelated items or if the data type is not a certificate or certificate chain.
      IllegalStateException - if the PEM data contains an unexpected type.

    • asCertificateChainArray

      public X509Certificate[] asCertificateChainArray() throws PemData.PemException
      Converts the current PEM data into an array of X509Certificate objects. This method facilitates retrieval of all certificates in the PEM data as an array.
      Returns:
      an array of X509Certificate objects representing the certificate(s) contained in the PEM data. The array will be empty if there are no certificates.
      Throws:
      PemData.PemException - if the PEM data is invalid, contains unsupported types, or if there are errors during certificate processing.

    • asPublicKey

      public PublicKey asPublicKey() throws PemData.PemException
      Converts the PEM data contained within this instance into a PublicKey. This method expects the PEM data to contain exactly one item of type PemType.PUBLIC_KEY. If the conditions are not met, a PemException is thrown.
      Returns:
      a PublicKey object representing the public key contained in the PEM data.
      Throws:
      PemData.PemException - if the PEM data does not contain exactly one item, or if the item type is not PemType.PUBLIC_KEY.

    • asPrivateKey

      public PrivateKey asPrivateKey() throws PemData.PemException
      Converts the current PEM data into a PrivateKey object. This method ensures that the PEM data contains exactly one item of type PemType.PRIVATE_KEY or throws a PemData.PemException if the data does not meet expectations.
      Returns:
      a PrivateKey object extracted from the PEM data.
      Throws:
      PemData.PemException - if the PEM data does not contain exactly one item, if the item is not of type PemType.PRIVATE_KEY, or if the private key is encrypted.

    • asPrivateKey

      public PrivateKey asPrivateKey(char[] password) throws PemData.PemException
      Converts the PEM data into a PrivateKey object. This method supports both plain and encrypted private key PEM entries. If the key is encrypted, the provided password will be used to decrypt it. The password array is securely cleared after use.
      Parameters:
      password - the password used to decrypt the private key, if the key is encrypted. This must be a non-null character array.
      Returns:
      the PrivateKey object represented by the PEM data.
      Throws:
      PemData.PemException - if the PEM data does not contain exactly one private key or if an error occurs during decryption.
      IllegalStateException - if the PEM data contains multiple entries.

    • asKeyPair

      public KeyPair asKeyPair() throws PemData.PemException
      Converts the PEM object to a KeyPair if it is a valid and single key pair. This method expects the PEM object to contain exactly one key pair of type PemType.KEY_PAIR or PemType.ENCRYPTED_KEY_PAIR. If the key pair is encrypted, an exception is thrown to suggest using an alternative method that accepts a password for decryption.
      Returns:
      the KeyPair contained in the PEM object.
      Throws:
      PemData.PemException - if the PEM object does not contain exactly one key pair, or if the key pair is encrypted.

    • asKeyPair

      public KeyPair asKeyPair(char[] password) throws PemData.PemException
      Converts the stored PEM content into a KeyPair object.

      Depending on the content type, this method parses and decrypts (if necessary) the PEM-encoded keys to create a KeyPair instance. It supports single-key configurations and multi-key configurations based on the internal structure.

      Parameters:
      password - the password to decrypt the key pair or private key if it is encrypted. This will be zeroed out (filled with '\0') after usage to ensure sensitive data is not retained in memory.
      Returns:
      the constructed KeyPair from the PEM data.
      Throws:
      PemData.PemException - if the PEM format is invalid, the required type is not present, the content types are mismatched, or if decryption fails.
